issues.description: Parameter type mismatch for Pneumatic.raisePressure: the UML in the problem statement declares raisePressure(pressure: double) (problem_statement.md, UML lines), but the solution implements the interface with raisePressure(int pressureIncrease) (solution_repository/src/de/tum/in/ase/Pneumatic.java and overridden in LaunchedDropdownTower and LaunchedRollerCoaster). This cross-artifact inconsistency will confuse students: the tasks explicitly ask to "declare Pneumatic according to the UML diagram", so students will implement a double parameter while the reference code (and some textual parts) uses int. It also makes automated checks or provided solution code incompatible with an implementation following the UML.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the parameter type for raisePressure across all artifacts. Either (A) change the UML and problem text to declare raisePressure(pressure: int) so they match the solution and overrides, or (B) change the solution and template interface and all overrides to use double (void raisePressure(double pressureIncrease)) to match the UML. Recommended: pick one type and update the problem statement (UML and any textual references), the template Pneumatic.java (provide the correct signature), and all implementing classes accordingly so students and reference code are consistent.

issues.description: Inner-artifact inconsistency within the problem statement: the UML declares raisePressure(pressure: double) (problem_statement.md UML lines), but the textual Remarks refer to raisePressure(int pressureIncrease) (problem_statement.md, remarks). This contradiction inside the problem statement itself will confuse students about the correct signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the problem statement internally consistent: either update the UML to declare raisePressure(pressure: int) to match the remarks, or update the Remarks to reference raisePressure(double). After resolving this, ensure the template and solution match the chosen signature so students have a single, unambiguous API to implement.

issues.description: The Pneumatic.raisePressure parameter is named and typed inconsistently across the artifacts. In the UML (problem_statement.md) the method is declared as raisePressure(pressure: double) (lines 16-19), but elsewhere in the problem text (remarks) and in the solution implementation the method is referenced/implemented as raisePressure(int pressureIncrease). This creates confusion about the expected parameter name and type: students reading the UML may expect a double parameter named 'pressure', while the solution and remarks use an int parameter named 'pressureIncrease'.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Pneumatic.raisePressure signature consistent across all artifacts. Either update the UML in problem_statement.md to match the implemented form (raisePressure(pressureIncrease: int)) and update the template Pneumatic.java to declare void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease), or change the solution/template to use the UML form (void raisePressure(double pressure)) and update the remarks accordingly. Prefer aligning the UML to the implementation (int pressureIncrease) since the remarks and solution already use that signature.
